byline.original: By Carin Rubenstein; Carin Rubenstein is a freelance writer who specializes in behavioral science

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: SHE IS A BUBBLY 10-YEAR-OLD with an almost invisible splash of freckles across her nose. As she jokes and fools around with her friends, Melanie's eyes twinkle with delight, but she quickly collects herself as she describes the teasing she endures because she's overweight.

headline.main: Strict Rules Imposed for Sitting in Airline Exit Rows

byline.original: By JOHN H. CUSHMAN Jr., Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Federal rules taking effect on Friday will restrict airline seats near exits to people in good physical condition who speak and read English and are otherwise able to help evacuate the plane in an emergency.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Federal rules taking effect on Friday will restrict airline seats near exits to people in good physical condition who speak and read English and are otherwise able to help evacuate the plane in an emergency.

headline.main: Children Are Focus Of Diet-Pill Issue

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: AMERICA'S obsession with dieting is having a severe impact on children, a House subcommittee was told last week in hearings addressing the safety of nonprescription diet pills.
docs.snippet: LEAD: AMERICA'S obsession with dieting is having a severe impact on children, a House subcommittee was told last week in hearings addressing the safety of nonprescription diet pills.
